grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 騒然【ソウゼン】noisy, confused, uproarious
狂躁【キョウソウ】mania, wild excitement
鼓譟【コソウ】motivating the troops on the battlefield with war drums and war cries, making an uproar
kun reading compounds: 騒ぐ【さわぐ】to make noise, to make racket, to be noisy, to rustle, to swoosh, to make merry, to clamor, to clamour, to make a fuss, to kick up a fuss, to lose one's cool, to panic, to act flustered, to feel tense, to be uneasy, to be excited
騒がしい【さわがしい】noisy, boisterous, turbulent (era, etc.), troubled
